intro: Banisteria quapara, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a flowering shrub or small tree that produces long, drooping clusters of yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its pinnate leaves and fragrant blooms. Its flowers are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
